parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
A tent pitched, a dwelling, tabernacle. From skenoo; an encampment, i.e. the Temple, the body.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.
